ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

name: r-mlr

about.summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.19.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mlr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mlr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mlr/mlr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 49d785160fa0d93be317573eb28b7926df1dc79991f58777b026b25bfb485c44

build:
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-ggplot2                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-survival                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-stringi                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-bbmisc                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-checkmate                # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-backports                # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-parallelmap              # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-paramhelpers             # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-xml                      # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-data.table               # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}          # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}  # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}    # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed             # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils       # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip             # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bbmisc >=1.11
    - r-paramhelpers >=1.10
    - r-xml
    - r-backports >=1.1.0
    - r-checkmate >=1.8.2
    - r-data.table >=1.12.4
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-parallelmap >=1.3
    - r-stringi
    - r-survival
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bbmisc >=1.11
    - r-paramhelpers >=1.10
    - r-xml
    - r-backports >=1.1.0
    - r-checkmate >=1.8.2
    - r-data.table >=1.12.4
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-parallelmap >=1.3
    - r-stringi
    - r-survival

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mlr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mlr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr
  license: BSD-2-Clause
  summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping
    and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_2_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Description: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

about.summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.
